FuncDef:
The remark vxlan reserved-value command configures an action of re-marking the VXLAN reserved field in a traffic behavior.
The undo remark vxlan reserved-value command deletes the configuration. The remark vxlan reserved-value command configures an action of re-marking the VXLAN reserved field in a traffic behavior. The undo remark vxlan reserved-value command deletes the configuration. By default, an action of re-marking the VXLAN reserved field is not configured in a traffic behavior. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the value of the VXLAN reserved field.
The value ranges from 0x000000 to 0xFFFFFF in hexadecimal notation, and start with 0x.

ExtraInfo: To provide differentiated services based on the VXLAN reserved field of packets, run the remark vxlan reserved-value command to configure the device to re-mark the VXLAN reserved field of packets so that the device can provide QoS based on the re-marked VXLAN reserved field.
